Sometimes by a rare piece of luck a pocket is found immediately, on the surface of the earth, as occurred recently in Dalmatia when Nero was emperor, one yielding fifty pounds weight of gold a day. Gold found in this way in the surface crust is called talutium if there is also auri- ferous earth underneath. The otherwise dry, barren mountains of the Spanish provinces which produce nothing else whatever are forced into fertility in regard to this commodity.

Gold dug up from shafts is called ‘ channelled ’ or ‘ trenched ’ gold; it is found sticking to the grit of marble, not in the way in which it gleams in the lapis lazuli of the East and the stone ὓ of Thebes ⁰ and in other precious stones, but sparkling in the folds of the marble, These channels of veins wander to and fro along the sides of the shafts, which gives the gold its name; and the earth is held up by wooden props.
